body: fix(c3_lsp): update root directory to be able to handle project in the following order - a C3 project 'project.json', a library '.c3l' dir, and ancestor 'git' repo.

comment_data.body:
why not do this? 
```suggestion
      local path = util.root_pattern {'project.json', 'manifest.json'}(fname);
```

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,14 @@ return {
   default_config = {
     cmd = { 'c3lsp' },
     root_dir = function(fname)
-      return util.root_pattern { 'project.json', '.git' }(fname)
+      --look for a project directory
+      local path = util.root_pattern { 'project.json', 'manifest.json' }(fname)
+      if path ~= nil then
+        return path
+      end
+
+      --look for .git directory
+      return util.find_git_ancestors(fname)

comment_data.body: @glepnir will this also work if we are editing the branch inside the '.git' directory instead of the working directory?

comment_data.body: this is an order will find every pattern until find root

comment_regular_data.body: The [original form](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/pull/3309#discussion_r1766846520) of this PR is a hint that we may need to clean up more of the existing configs, since I assume that was copied from some other config.
yes lots of content file are same.  might take a while to clean up, as there are a lot of files. I'll come back here after I've prioritized C's Pr.

> The [original form](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/pull/3309#discussion_r1766846520) of this PR is a hint that we may need to clean up more of the existing configs, since I assume that was copied from some other config.

Yes indeed, it was based on existing configurations. tanks for your help @glepnir  and @justinmk

title: fix: add C3 library support
